topics.body:
"@AaronMk":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5310077c6368720408a90000#post_5310077c6368720408a90000
http://english.pravda.ru/russia/politics/27-02-2014/126955-russia_ukraine_crimea-0/
They say they're not invading and that at only at the request of ukraine would they send troops to ukraine *. . .* but considering that there's russian soldiers in a ukraine airport for who knows what reason even if they're not this is going to be bad regardless.  The group in question is about 50 people in full russian navy getup.  Too many questions right now without answers.

Are they actual russian navy?  Are they just people dressed up like it?  If so then where did they get half of the equipment?  Military equipment isn't exactly easy to come by. .  Well rather to say it's not cheap to come by; anything is easy to come by if you have money, but fifty fully armed people dressed as russian navy?  Someone is trying to start shit.  Are they russian soldiers awol?

The only thing that is for certain right now is that they're trying to start shit and they need to be stopped before shit hits the fan.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
The Russian Navy maintains a base in Sevastopol in the Ukraine Crimea. It being there is part of the land deal they made to Ukraine where they ceded the Crimea to them: they get more land, but we still operate out of Sevestopol.

In so far as I heard the height of Russian activity is securing stuff around their Black Sea Fleet headquarters and flying a few jets close to the border. They want to threaten the current government into being more willing to accept continuing Russian hegemony.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53100db763687206ab160100#post_53100db763687206ab160100

Not really. World Economy is today's MAD and the least it'll do is lead to an isolationist Ukraine whose only defense is the diplomatic reputation of Russia. It'd really paint them in a bad way to perform such an obvious invasion, they'd need to find chemical weapons or some shit there.

But Ukraine's in Russia's sphere of Influence. It always has been. Or it's been a part of Russia in some way. Either as a province in the Empire of Russia or as an SSR in the Soviet Union or the Russian helmed Warsaw Pact.

To invade now would be an obvious way to maintain their own sphere of influence and Russia has too high a reputation to risk and too reliant an economy on everyone else to do it. They would need to bring up a case of something else, which would lead to questions about how Ukraine got nukes or chemical weapons and who; and the entire international community would be looking at Moscow. Their reputation would still be shamed.

The most they can do is try to rattle their sabers and work diplomatic influences to try and win favor in the backrooms to keep Ukraine in their pocket. They can't invade anyone without pissing off anybody. It'd be like the US invading Mexico for the same reason.

And if they do anything military-level to maintain order it'll probably be more clandestine and indirect.

In irrelevant news, have some I-just-got-on-and-caught-up-Greentext "ranting". Which is more me having to dump some bullshit on an unwilling friend about other bullshit, but it's amusing all the same.

AaronMk: > Skype chat
AaronMk: > 2:30 in the morning
<friend>: Hmm?
<friend>: O
AaronMk: > Guy's saying "Your Highness" is insulting
AaronMk: >  Refute
<friend>: Lol.
AaronMk: > Double check refuting, it's a legit thing of honor. Expected
AaronMk: > Post link to confirmation
AaronMk: > Still refutes
<friend>: o gawd
AaronMk: > Links to page on titles and shit for British nobles
AaronMk: > Still lists "His/Her Majesty"
AaronMk: > Point this out
<friend>: And on top, you see 'Chapatrap-heir to the throne'
AaronMk: > Continues to refute, posts some shit web-page for make-believe nation
AaronMk: > Even then "Highness" is still acceptable
AaronMk: > Point out
AaronMk: > Go through entire fucking page and point out how it's not a legit citation because the author doesn't exist, nor any land associated with him
AaronMk: > He gets mad.
Chapatrap: Wow.
AaronMk: > Claims humans evolved to debate just to sound smart.
AaronMk: > YeahI'mDoneHere.jpg

THAT GUY JUST

okay done ranting"
